title: Chemistry
desc: Chemistry Self-paced learning modules  in line with Core curriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Matter - Introduction to properties of matter and how temperature and pressure affect matter
Mixture - Pure and impure substances. Mixture, solutions and colloids
Laws of Chemical combinations - Introduction to chemical reactions and laws of combinations
Atoms and Molecules - Atoms, molecules, molecular mass and mole concepts
Atomic Structure - Structure of atoms and Electronic configuration
Periodic table - Atomic number, mass number and the periodic table
Metals and non-metals - Classification and properties of metals and non-metals
Carbon-Carbon and its compounds and various reactions of carbon
Synthetic Materials - Synthetic materials, polymers and plastics
Coal and Petroleum - Introduction to hydrocarbons
Combustion - Chemistry of combustion and flames

title: Chemistry
desc: Chemistry Self-paced learning modules  in line with Core curriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Matter - Composition of matter, states of matter & effects of temperature and pressure on matter
Elements compounds and mixtures - Introduction to mixtures, solution, colloids etc. and other physical combinations
Gas Laws - Introduction to gas laws, relationship with temperature and temperature scales
Chemical formulae - Language of chemistry and writing chemical formulae
Physical and Chemical changes - Defenition of physical and chemical changes and types of chemical reactions
Water - Introduction to water and its chemical properties
Atomic Structure - Structure of an Atom mass number and atomic number, Isotopes and Octet Rule
Periodic table - General idea of Dobereiner's Triads, Newland's law of Octaves, Mendeleev's periodic law, Discovery of Atomic Number and its use as a basis for Modern Periodic law
Hydrogen - Detailed study of the first element hydrogen, its properties and other aspects
Atmospheric pollution - Introduction to atmospheric pollution and its impacts locally and globally

title: Chemistry
desc: Chemistry Self-paced learning modules  in line with Core curriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Chemical reactions - Different kinds of chemical reactions -combinations, oxidation reactions, displacement etc.
Chemical Equations - Writing balanced chemical reactions
Acids and bases - Chemical properties of acids and bases, reactions, salts and introduction to pH
Metals and non-metals - Physical and chemical properties of metals and non-metals
Extraction of metals - How metals are extracted, oxidation, corrosion in metals and their prevention
Organic compounds - Carbon and its versatility, Saturated and unsaturated carbon compounds, the nomenclature of carbon compounds
Chemical reaction and carbon compounds - Ethanol, carbon-based acids and chemical reactions with organic compounds
Periodic table - Classification of elements and Mendeleev's table

title: Mathematics
desc: Mathematics self paced learning modules  in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Rational Numbers - Closure, commutative and associative property of rational numbers along with concepts like distributive and associative properties
Linear Equations - Simplifying and solving linear equations
Polygons - Polygon properties, classifications and various characteristics
Constructing quadrilateral - Constructing quadrilaterals and special cases of polygons
Graphs - Various types of graphs and how to create them
Probability - Introduction to probability
Square, cubes and Square roots - How to find square and cube of a number and to calculate square and cube roots and factorization
Ratios and Percentages - Ratios and percentages
Profit and Loss - Understanding profit and loss, simple and compound interest and discounts and taxes
Algebraic expressions - Algebraic identity level 1 to level 4
Solids and Shapes - Visualizing 3D shapes and their features like area, surface area and volume
Exponents and Powers - Laws of exponents, proportions and exponents with the power of integers
Factorization - Factorization and factorization of algebraic equations using different methods
Introduction to graphs - Introduction to various graphs, their application and concept of the coordinate system
Playing with numbers - Divisibility and other features of numbers

title: Mathematics
desc: Mathematics self paced learning modules  in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Number system - Introduction to rational and irrational numbers, their operations and representations
Polynomials - Degrees of polynomials, reminder and factor theorems
Coordinate Geometry - Meaning and components of cartesian plane and plotting
Linear Equations - Solving linear equations with variables and developing graphs
Euclid's Geometry - Introduction to definitions, postulates and axioms of Euclidian geometry
Lines and Angles - Basic terms of lines, angles and parallelism
Triangles - Introduction to types of triangles, their properties and congruencies
Quadrilaterals - Introduction to various properties of quadrilaterals and midpoint theorem
Circles - Circles, concentric circles, chords and other related terms and features
Constructing Shapes - Constructing triangles, angles and different geometric shapes based on the given information
Heron's formula - Introduction to heron's formula and its application
Surface area and Volume - Surface area and volume calculation of various geometric figures
Statistics - Introduction to statistics, frequency distribution and central tendencies

title: Mathematics
desc: Mathematics self paced learning modules  in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Real numbers - Theorems of arithmetic -Euclid, rational and irrational numbers and decimal expansions
Polynomials - Relationship between roots and polynomials and division algorithms
Linear Equations - Solving linear equations with substitution, elimination as well as cross multiplication methods and developing graphs
Quadratic Equations - Introduction to quadratic equations and solving quadratic equations.
Arithmetic progressions - Meaning and components of arithmetic progression.
Triangles - Similarity of Triangles and Theorems and criterion-related to triangles
Coordinate Geometry - Distance, section and areas of triangle
Trigonometry - Introduction to trigonometry, ratios, problems and real-life application of trigonometry
Circles - Circles, tangents, divisions of circle and various properties of circles
Constructions - Construction of similar triangles, areas of circles, combinations of plain figures
Surface area and Volume - Surface area and volume calculation of various geometric figures and conversion of area and volume across figures
Statistics - Introduction to mean, median and mode and their relationship
Probability - Basics of probability and its application in the game of coins, dies and cards

title: Physics
desc: Physics self paced learning modules  in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Force and pressure - Basics of force, pressure and newtons laws of motion
Friction - Understanding friction and how it works
Light and Sound - Introduction to light and sound as a form of energy and its properties
Stars and Solar system - Introduction to stars, solar system and planetary motion
Electricity and Magnetism - Electricity and magnetism. Its interaction and how the electricity flow happens

title: Physics
desc: Physics self paced learning modules  in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Motion - Introduction to linear, uniform and non-uniform motion
Vector - Concepts of non-linear motion, velocity, acceleration and representations
Work and Energy - Concept of force, work and different kinds of energy
Sound - Introduction to nature of sound and types of sounds
Gravitation - Gravitation, Force of gravity and how celestial bodies move
Laws of motion - First, second and third laws of motion and conservation of momentum
Laws of Energy - Conversion of energy, momentum and conservation of energy and momentum

title: Physics
desc: Physics self paced learning modules  in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Properties of Light - Introduction to properties of light like reflection, refraction and various types of mirrors
Vision - Structure of eye and correction of vision using a lens
Electricity - Introduction to conduction, resistance, ohms law and heating effects of electric current
Magnetism - Introduction to magnetism and field lines
Electricity and Magnetism - Understanding electromagnetism, induction and electric motors
Energy sources - Introduction to conventional and non-conventional sources of energy

title: Biology
desc: Biology self paced learning modules in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Ecosystem - Introduction to the ecosystem and various types and components of the ecosystem
Micro-Organisms - Introduction to micro-organisms and who is friend and foe
Conservation - Importance of ecological conservation and how we can help
Cell Structure - Introduction to plant and animal cell structure
Reproduction - Types of reproduction in animals and plants
Agriculture - Crop production management
Reaching the age of adolescence - Changes in the human body during adolescence
Coal and Petroleum - How coal and petroleum formed and their significance

title: Biology
desc: Biology self paced learning modules in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Cell Structure - Understanding cell structure and functions of structures like the nucleus, cytoplasm, nucleus etc.
Cell organelles - Details on cell organelles
Plant tissues - Introduction to plant tissues
and different types of plant tissues
Animal tissues - Introduction to animal tissues and different types of animal tissues
Living Organisms Classifications - Five kingdoms of living organisms and methods of binomial nomenclature
Plant Kingdom - Introduction to the different plant kingdom
Animal Kingdom - Introduction to different animal kingdoms
Natural resources - Details and conservation of natural resources like soil, water and air and biochemical cycles

title: Biology
desc: Biology self paced learning modules in line with Core carriculum/CBSE/ICSE syllabus

timeline.value: Food and Nourishment - Introduction to crop improvement, animal husbandry and its importance in nutrition
Life process - Introduction to processes of nutrition, respiration, excretion etc., which is common in all living forms
Control and coordination of body - Nervous system and endocrine system in animals and control and coordination in plants
Reproduction - Basics of reproduction in plants and animals and its advantage and disadvantage
Female health - Menustration and reproductive health, sex determination and puberty
Evolution - Theory and evidence of evolution, traits and natural selection
Heredity - Introduction to genes, monohybrid and dihybrid cross and basics of genetic transmission
Environmental studies - Components of the ecosystem, climate change and other environmental issues like ozone depletion and pollution
Managing natural resources - Importance of forests and nature preservation and various methods and needs of soil and water conservation
